group_1.progressNarration: [textBlack:Concerned about what the Neo-Magius was@up to, I visited Puella Care's trailer.@As if on cue, Miss Himena showed up, and I@was able to get a bit of a sense of her.]
[textBlack:From what I could glean, Miss Himena was@about to do something very dangerous,@but I couldn't tell much more than that.]

[textBlack:But then, in the middle of Miss Himena's@enhancement, the color drained from@Miss Livia's face, and she said something@that turned that vague sense of danger@into something much more concrete.]
[textBlack:"I can't stay neutral about this.@If things keep going this way,@we're headed straight toward that@resignation of Miss Himuro."]
[textBlack:I wasn't sure what she meant by that,@but without any other way to pursue@the Neo-Magius, I went to check on@the Tokime Clan for the time being.]

[textBlack:If society unwittingly gives rise to@Magical Girls, then the Tokime Clan's@Diviners arose as a result@of being used by society.@Miss Shizuka, who started as a pure@and innocent Diviner, was used, and@after going to the city her mind was@distorted by the evil around her.]
[textBlack:As though some unseen force is at work,@every Magical Girl that I see with my@eyes seems to be influenced by their@surroundings to go down a dark path.]
[textBlack:If Miss Nayuta's father gave up on@telling the world about Magical Girls@because he thought it would lead to@suffering for everyone, then I want to@use my research to reject that outcome.]
[textBlack:This is what lead me to Suitoku Temple,@believing that Miss Shizuka and the Tokime@Clan would come together once again.]

group_1.textLeft: Have you left the Neo-Magius to@come back to the Tokime Clan?

group_1.textRight: It's the other way around, Charu.
It was all of you that rejected my views as@clan head and left the Tokime Clan.

group_1.textLeft: Looks like Shizuka hasn't budged an inch.

group_1.textRight: Yes, it doesn't seem that she's here to return to us...
That's right, I'm here to try once more to make you@see reason. I want you all to stand by my side...

group_1.textLeft: I already gave you my answer.

group_1.textRight: In order for people to be led down the right path,@it must be a Diviner standing at the top.
Himena Aika may be the one@in charge in the beginning,
but if she brings suffering to@people outside of Kamihama,
then I will strike her down, saving everyone.
Then the Diviners will have the people's respect,
and we'll be able to perform deeds that bring@out the goodness inside everyone.

group_1.textLeft: ...Such arrogance.
If I am no longer a member of the Tokime Clan,@then I will speak against it.
Is that alright with all of you?
Yes, go right ahead.
Shizuka, you're trying to vanquish@Himena Aika to acquire respect.
That's not the problem. The problem is@the way that you're treating the people.
You hold an ideal image of how a person should be,@and you stand above others to fit that mold.
Then you bind the people with rules, and fear...
That's no different from what Mikoshiba did, binding@and manipulating us with the rules of the village.
She made those rules to force@us to fit into her ideal mold,
and she eliminated anyone who didn't conform.
Look, Shizuka, I get where@you're coming from, okay?
But still, you can't just force people@to be how you want them to be.
Besides, I'm sure Himena Aika is just using you.

group_1.textRight: Is that what your nose says...?

group_1.textLeft: Well...not exactly, but...
There are people who can commit evil deeds@with a pure heart, without malice.
She is one such person.

group_1.textRight: ...It's a pity that you don't understand.

group_1.textLeft: I also find it quite regrettable.
I don't care if you resent me for it, now that@you're here I won't allow you to leave.
Me too, I've decided to knock some@sense into the clan head...
I won't let you go back to the Neo-Magius.@I'm gonna bring you home!
